name: The Five Cores of Suffering
description: Long ago, the Hag of Hag's Addle wove a forbidden ritual meant to harvest the five deepest human emotions — grief, rage, fear, desire, and hope — and condense them into five Eldritch Cores. With all five, she would breach a gate into a forgotten faerie dominion, restore her ancient power, and rewrite the balance between human and fairy realms. But the ritual failed. Instead of binding the emotions to herself, they scattered into mortal souls across Dolmenwood — each becoming a cursed host.

objectives.text: Find the Core of Grief (Weeping Feather Core)
Find the Core of Rage
objectives.notes: Host unknown, likely in High Wold

objectives.text: Find the Core of Fear
Find the Core of Desire
objectives.notes: Host unknown, likely on Fairy Road

objectives.text: Find the Core of Hope

stakes: If the Hag gets all 5 Cores, she will breach a gate into a forgotten faerie dominion and rewrite the balance between human and fairy realms.

name: Core of Grief — The Weeping Feather
description: Zoemina, the innkeeper of the Roost Inn, was one of the Five Cursed Bearers. Her curse evolved into the Weeping Feather Core. Her lover Thirlirgwe risked everything, accepting power from the Queen of Blackbirds to save her.

objectives.text: Discover Zoemina's curse
Find a way to extract the core
Use the Anti-Prism to amplify and crack the curse
Extract the Weeping Feather Core with Cain's Pulpit

aftermath: The Grimalkins watched the extraction, signaling the Hag now knows the party can pull out Cores. The core now pulses with sorrow, memory, emotional resonance, and the echo of Thirlirgwe's devotion.

name: Core of Rage — The Burning Brand
description: Someone whose anger is literally eating them from inside. The corruption manifests as berserk fury.

objectives.text: Find the host of the Core of Rage
Restrain the host before extraction
Extract the Core of Rage

core_abilities: Unknown — speculation: rage empowerment, berserker mode

name: Core of Fear — The Hollow Mask
description: Someone living in hiding or illusion. The corruption creates fear hallucinations.

objectives.text: Find the host of the Core of Fear
Overcome the fear hallucinations
Extract the Core of Fear

party_roles.Ninuel: Stabilize with White Flame, resist fear
party_roles.Enmog: Frost Sight to see through illusions

core_abilities: Unknown — speculation: fear aura, illusion sense

name: Core of Desire — The Gilded Chain
description: Someone seduced by faerie beauty or addiction. The corruption charms those who try to extract it.

objectives.text: Find the host of the Core of Desire
Resist the charm effects
Extract the Core of Desire

mechanics.extraction_method: Must resist charm; chains become drawn toward the wielder
core_abilities: Unknown — speculation: charm aura, desire sense

name: Core of Hope — The Fading Light
description: Often a child, new parent, or innocent. The hardest core to extract — hope resists separation, and the corruption feeds on it. This one will hit emotionally the hardest.

objectives.text: Find the host of the Core of Hope
Find a way to extract without destroying hope
Extract the Core of Hope

mechanics.challenge: The corruption feeds on hope; extracting may kill the host's spirit

party_roles.Ninuel: White Flame to preserve the soul
party_roles.Enmog: Unknown — comic relief may become tragic here

core_abilities: Unknown — speculation: hope aura, morale boost, light

biome: Prigwort or a place with festivals

name: The Grimalkins' Watch
description: The Grimalkins are mysterious fae cats tied to the Queen of Blackbirds — or perhaps the Hag. They perch on trees, ruins, rooftops: watching, counting, judging, reporting. Their presence will escalate as more cores awaken.

objectives.text: Discover who the Grimalkins truly serve
Determine if they are friend or foe

stakes: They may lead the Hag directly to the party, or they may be secretly helping.

name: The Hag's Gambit
description: The Hag wants the party to gather all 5 Cores because she can't locate all the hosts herself — some are protected by other faerie powers. She will subtly guide, manipulate, test, deceive, reward, and threaten. When the 5 cores are brought together, she will attempt to rip them from the party and ignite the ritual properly.

objectives.text: Survive the Hag's manipulations
Discover her true plan
Stop her from completing the ritual

stakes: The Hag will attempt to take all 5 Cores by force once gathered.

name: The Queen's Counter
description: The Queen of Blackbirds has a competing agenda. Since Thirlirgwe is tied to her, she may send agents, offer boons, warn the party, or try to take the Cores for herself. Her domain is memory, sorrow, and transformation, making her a direct thematic rival to the Hag.

objectives.text: Determine the Queen's true intentions
Decide whether to ally with her

stakes: The Queen may help or hinder — her goals are not the party's goals.

name: The Ruby Contract
description: When Enmog raised the ruby amulet during the Lantern-Bearer battle, Azelach answered. A life was restored — Ninuel breathed again. But a debt formed instantly. One life restored = one life owed.

objectives.text: Deliver a living soul to Azelach within one lunar cycle
objectives.notes: The life must be: living, resisting death, conscious of its own mortality. Souls already in the Land of the Dead are ineligible.

objectives.text: OR: Find a way to break the contract
OR: Ascend to the Land of the Living (escape his jurisdiction)

failure_consequence: The debtor (Enmog) AND the pledged soul (Ninuel) both join the Choir as bound voices
stakes: Failure means Enmog and Ninuel are lost forever to the Choir.

name: The Hag's Bargain — Three Feathers
description: The party struck a deal with the Hag of Hag's Addle. In exchange for the stolen poniard, they must find three souls marked with raven feathers by the Queen of Blackbirds and pluck the feathers free.

objectives.text: Find the first feathered soul
Find the second feathered soul
Find the third feathered soul
Pluck the feathers and return them to the Hag

warning: Alfwine says: 'These feathers are curses. They mark those the Queen watches. Pluck them, and the victims will never dream again.'
stakes: The party is now in the middle of a faerie cold war between the Hag and the Queen of Blackbirds.

name: The Stolen Poniard
description: A ceremonial woodcutter's dagger (the Poniard) was stolen from Jock Furngle at the Stump & Poniard Tavern. The dagger isn't magical, but culturally it's priceless — used during woodcutter rites and considered a symbol of their lineage. Its theft caused shame, anger, and fear that something unnatural lurked nearby. Enmog negotiated partial ownership of the tavern if he could recover it.

objectives.text: PHASE 1: Gather clues at the Stump & Poniard
objectives.notes: Found reed fibers, swampy mud, hoof-like tracks (Reedwalkers), trail heading NW

objectives.text: PHASE 2: Track the thief through the swamp
objectives.notes: Visited Flotsam Pools, met Tekwell Onehorn, learned Reedwalkers serve the Hag

objectives.text: PHASE 3: Navigate the Louping Wood crossroads
objectives.notes: Party took multiple paths including Tower of Frost, Soul Pond

objectives.text: PHASE 4: Confront the Hag at her lair
objectives.notes: Found poniard embedded in a reed idol. Made bargain with the Hag instead of taking it by force.

objectives.text: Complete the Hag's Bargain (Three Feathers) to retrieve it
Return the poniard to Jock Furngle

evidence_found: Reed fibers stuck in the windowsill
Metal drag in mud — as if a dagger sheath was pulled along
Direction of travel: NW toward deeper Hag's Addle
what_the_hag_was_doing: Not magical — symbolic. She's corrupting the dagger to break woodcutter tradition and weaken community morale. Part of a larger plan to dissolve loyalties and replace them with her influence.

from_jock: Free lodging for life at the Stump & Poniard
Local woodcutters treat the party as heroes
+1 on Reaction rolls with woodcutter NPCs
Rumors, leads, future quests in the region
already_earned: Pin of the Poniard (Enmog) — social benefits, 'blood-brother' to woodcutters
optional_physical_rewards: A Woodcutter's Axe (+1 vs plant creatures)
A cask of Woodcutter Amber Ale
A handcrafted wooden charm against fey

hidden_meta_reward: By disrupting the Reedwalkers' theft and finding the Hag's lair, the party is now marked as 'dangerously capable.' The Hag sends Grimalkins to observe them. She becomes interested in their ability to extract Cores. She rewrote her plans to USE them rather than oppose them. The Stolen Poniard Quest unintentionally put the party on the Hag's path — leading directly into the Five Cores arc.
future_upgrade: Once the party gathers all 5 cores, the Poniard may transform into THE CUTTER'S OATH — a weapon blessed by woodcutters, meant to resist fae corruption. Could become symbolic in a liberation arc against the Hag.

name: The Lantern-House Crypt
description: Father Jymes Horsely asks the party to investigate the Lantern-House Crypt. It was once a shrine to St. Foggarty before the swamp swallowed it. A holy relic known as Foggarty's First Flame was housed there — a flame that never went out, used by lost travelers to find their way home. Recently, strange lights have been seen in that direction — green, not gold. The father worries something unholy has taken root.

objectives.text: Travel to the Lantern-House Crypt
Investigate the strange green lights
Recover or cleanse Foggarty's First Flame
Report back to Father Horsely

name: Drive Out the Hag
description: Father Horsely asked the party to drive the Hag out of Hag's Addle. Her lair moves with the dawn. The swamps have been 'louder' lately — whispering at night, the marsh lights burning green instead of gold, and travelers reporting strange silhouettes watching from the reeds.

objectives.text: Find the Hag's Hut
Drive her out of Hag's Addle
objectives.notes: Complicated — the party made a deal with her instead

stakes: The Hag's presence corrupts the land. But can she even be driven out?
